diseaseDiagnosisDescription: Upload a photo of the affected plant to get an AI-powered diagnosis.
diseaseLibraryDescription: Common diseases affecting crops in India.
powderyMildewDesc: A fungal disease that appears as white powdery spots on leaves and stems. Thrives in high humidity and moderate temperatures.
lateBlightDesc: Caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans, this disease causes lesions on leaves, stems, and fruits. Common in tomatoes and potatoes.
bacterialLeafSpotDesc: Appears as water-soaked spots on leaves which turn dark. Spreads quickly in wet and warm conditions.
rustDesc: Fungal disease causing reddish-brown pustules on leaves. It can reduce plant vigor and yield.

preventiveGuidanceDescription: Proactive AI-powered advice to protect your crops based on local weather.
highHumidityAlertDesc: High humidity increases the risk of fungal diseases like Powdery Mildew and Blight. Ensure good air circulation around plants and consider preventive bio-fungicide sprays if this condition persists.
rainForecastedDesc: Avoid overhead irrigation to prevent leaf wetness. After rain, check for waterlogging and ensure proper drainage to prevent root rot.
highTemperaturesDesc: High heat can stress plants. Ensure adequate watering, preferably in the early morning or late evening. Applying mulch can help retain soil moisture and keep roots cool.
favorableConditionsDesc: Current weather conditions are favorable. Continue standard monitoring and good farming practices. Stay vigilant for any changes in plant health.
generalTipDesc: Always ensure your fields have good air circulation to reduce humidity on leaf surfaces, which discourages many fungal pathogens.
